question: Which Indian state has tabled a bill to abolish all state-run Madrassas by converting them into general schools?
explanation:
The Assam government recently tabled a Bill in the Legislative Assembly to abolish all state-run Madrassas by converting them into general schools from April 1, 2021.
Amid constant objections on tabling the Assam Repealing Bill, 2020, it was placed on the first day of the winter session. There are 610 state-run Madrassas across Assam and the state government is spending Rs 260 crore annually.
